page.title: 13CHURCHES AT HEATHER
page.content: The Church Patronal Festival has been revived and this year will be enhanced by a Flower Festival and parade of youth Organisations. In March 1828 a piece of land was purchased from Benjamin Bradley of Heather by Trustees appointed from the Ashby Wesleyan Circuit. It cost four shillings. The release document reads, "It is intended shortly to build a Chapel for the worship of Almighty God." Wesley Chapel was built at a cost of Â£250. The Methodist Church in Heather had begun. A further plot of land was bought in 1898 for a Schoolroom. This was built alongside for "less than Â£100". More recent additions have been a font, kitchen facilities, clock, an Anniversary platform and flower pedestal.
